                                                                    View on MapAdmissionsAlready AppliedCurrent page:  Accept Admissions Offer
                        
    		Accept Admissions Offer
    	You’re a Wildcat Now! Go ahead, do your happy dance and celebrate—you’ve earned it! Congratulations from all of us at Chico State. We’re excited for you and can’t wait to welcome you to campus. Take the next steps to make your enrollment official today!
                        Sign into the Student Center
                    Log into the Student Center(opens in new window) (or claim your account if you haven’t already done so).
                        Declare Your Intent
                    Select Accept/Decline Admissions from the Admissions section of the menu and click Accept!
                        Pay Deposit
                    Pay a $200 enrollment confirmation deposit. (Students who are exempt will skip this step.)Deadline to accept your offer is May 1. Need help? Watch our video walkthrough(opens in new window) or call us at 1-800-542-4426. To pay the enrollment confirmation deposit, select "Newly ADMITTED Students ONLY," then select either domestic or international as it applies to you.VisitJoin us for the Choose Chico open house on March 25 or schedule a tour.Admitted fall 2023 students will receive an email invitation to attend Choose Chico, the exclusive event where you will discover everything that makes Chico State a special place. Save the date for March 25, 2023!Next StepsReview Upcoming DeadlinesMark your calendar for important dates and deadlines for housing, registration, submitting transcripts, and more, and visit your personalized To-Do List in the Student Center(opens in new window).Apply for AidMost students qualify for some form of financial aid to help pay for school.Steps for Financial Aid (FAFSA/California Dream Act)Wildcat Scholarship ApplicationSubmit Your Final TranscriptsMail your transcript(s) to the Office of Admissions. First-time student transcripts must include high school graduation date and transfer student transcripts must include fall semester grades.Check Your Wildcat Mail RegularlyOfficial notifications from the University related to enrollment, fees, and financial aid will be sent to your Wildcat email (NAME@csuchico.edu), so check the account often or set up email forwarding.Complete Your Eligibility RequirementsFinish the rest of the school-year strong! Offers of admission are conditional until course and grade requirements complete.Apply for HousingCheck out our on-campus housing and dining options and apply for a place in the residence halls or view off-campus options.Follow Chico State on Social MediaCelebrate becoming a Wildcat by tagging @ChicoState and follow our accounts for a sneak peek at student life.Deposit Exemption InformationStudents who qualify for one of the following exceptions will not be prompted to pay the non-refundable $200 enrollment confirmation deposit when submitting their intent to enroll.You do not have to pay an enrollment deposit if you:received an application fee waiver at the time of applicationreceived an expected family contribution (EFC) of $5,200 or less on the State or Federal Student Aid Reportare admitted to the Educational Opportunity Program (EOP)applied to the nursing program as an upper-division transfer studentare a veteran of the armed servicesare a Chico State employee in the career development programWe acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, the Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus.We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.MenuChico State HomeAboutAcademicsAdmissionsCost & AidStudent LifeAcademic DepartmentsAthleticsAlumniParentsChico FactsGiveResourcesQuicklinksCampus CalendarCampus SafetyJob OpportunitiesAccessibility Resource CenterAnnual Security Report (PDF)
We acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus. We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.Contact UsNeed Help?FacebookFacebookTwitterTwitterInstagramInstagramReport an accessibility issueReport a broken link on this pageTitle IXPrivacy PolicyCalifornia State University, Chico400 West First StreetChico, CA 95929Copyright © 2023 All Rights Reserved
